intro: Seriola scabra, commonly known as the rough scabbardfish, is a marine species belonging to the family Scombridae. It is characterized by its elongated body, compressed shape, and a distinctive rough texture on its skin. The fish has a silvery body with a dark lateral line and a generally streamlined appearance. It is found in tropical and subtropical waters, often inhabiting coastal areas and open seas. Botanically, it is not a plant, but its name may be confused with botanical terms due to its common name.
